text: I attend the Senior Citizens Center there daily from 9am to 1pm.  It's a place where we can interact with other seniors of like interests and they serve us a hot meal.  We fellowship, play games, exercise and have presentations from various local organizations which provide services for seniors.

name: Emma
text:
Christ’s radical inclusion is in this place. Openly
Welcoming and celebrating of LGBTQ+, atheists looking for a community, those who have been spurned by more conservative Christian faith. Love, compassion, equity, inclusion defined at Edgewood Presbyterian.

text: They are truly a loving and safe place for everyone. And Joe Genau is a great preacher. I also love the way a person can wear what they are comfortable in and excepted with suit or shorts.

name: Mitchell West
text: My son has been with North Hills Childcare for over 2 years. We have been incredibly happy with them for their attitude and patience with my son and his general wildness. While I am not a member of the church, I have become friends with their pastor, Adam, and believe him to be a good pastor and a good man. I adore North Hills, and would recommend them to anyone!

text: The early childhood center is top notch!  If you are looking for pre-k program or summer camp, I highly recommend this place.  The teachers and staff are amazing.  I have received numerous compliments on my child's behavior, knowledge and praying abilities.

text: The people are genuine and really love Jesus! The youth group has been amazing for my 6th grader, it is fun and at the same time works to really teach the true gospel to her!!

name: Choose kindness
text: Nice Church good service Pastor was on point. I like the facility it was very clean the downside would be the snooty congregation that did not seem open to visitors. But I believe in the house of God as long as you are hearing the word that's what matters. They did not make me feel guilty at donation time so I was willing to donate or tied my money I would say that I learned from the service from the teachings of the preacher or his reading of the Gospel I should say and would recommend families give it a try as long as you don't mind putting up with a few snooty people in a they are everywhere it's not a bad Church.

name: Bryant Meredith
text: Great church if you're in Mobile and need to hear a gospel message. The pastor is the best you could ever ask for. Be advised this is by no means a Presbyterian church, WHATSOEVER. They've identified with the PCA, but they'd do better to go non-denominational because that's what they are. My wife and I prefer a more historically orthodox and liturgical church, so we left, but that was totally a choice of aesthetics.

name: John Gordon Lewis
text: About 6 weeks ago I saw online a Wednesday evening hymn singing at Trinity and thought I would come listen. There was a welcoming spirit I had not expected (no one there knew me) and I was invited to eat a meal that was prepared.  Conversation was interesting intelligent and polite and the music was wonderful. I received multiple invitations to Sunday school and Bible studies. I have taken them up on these and have been learning and growing and feel so much more than just welcome...

text: Great church, good people, great preschool program with teachers who genuinely care for your children and their well-being. Carley Beeker is an excellent director and her staff reflects her devotion to making this one of the top childcare programs in Tuscaloosa!

The way that the congregation makes you feel comfortable and relaxed is unmatched in my opinion. Thanks, P Dukes

name: Amanda Hendricks
text:
My husband and I live out of town, but wanted to have a downtown Birmingham wedding. I was raised as Presbyterian, which was my original lure to hosting our wedding ceremony at First Presbyterian Church. But, what made us fully decide was the beautiful sanctuary and friendly staff.

Cat was our preacher and Margie was our coordinator. Everything turned out beautifully!!

We cannot wait to come back to Birmingham to visit their worship service!

text: If you are looking for a church? With family or single..... this place is for you!! Don't decide without experiencing it! I bet you will love it!

name: Brice Jackson
text: Wonderful place! Thought provoking music & message. Great Children’s & Family activities! Men’s & Women’s Discipleship Training (Battle for the Heart) is Life Altering!

name: Charles Relfe
text:
Have you ever wondered if there's anything real, I mean tangibly authentic, about God, Jesus, and the Bible.  More than a passing thought.  Using your whole mind.  Not being swept by emotion.  Serious consideration.  What difference would it make.  And several dozen other questions were answered for me.  A building is just that.  A building.  But the people I've come to know have become family.   The kind of family you can call when life gets hard.  Or help another when crisis erupts.  Most of all, the people are well grounded in grace.  Grace is key to this community.  It's a safe place to be yourself.  No pretending to smile when things are a wreck.  It's one beggar telling another beggar where there's food.
This  has been a place of learning.   Not mere data.  Truth.  The kind of truth you chew on, mull over, and wrestle with.  Truth that forms character. Strengthens convictions about what matters.  Learning to love your neighbor...even the one who steps on every raw nerve... not in a 'gut it out' sort of a way.  Loving that neighbor because it's in you, really in you, to love.  Truth that transforms.
Oak Mountain is a great place to taste and see the God of the Bible.  Real goodness, love and peace.  Not just a Sunday morning event with the typical sermon and songs. (Although they are top notch.)  But, you could just as easily find excellent teaching and music on the Internet.  We were created for community.  Community with the Creator and with each other.  Community full of grace and truth.  I never realized how starved I was for these.  Life is tough, but now I'm fed. And do my best to help others find the same.

name: Jim Lowrey
text: One of the few Churches that truly understand Grace, make you feel wanted & welcomed, and most important Preach & Teach the Bible as it has been written,  not bending to "culture".

name: Bill Tiemann
text: Don't know much about the church but the Westminster school is top notch. Top notch teachers, leadership, curriculum and wholesome atmosphere.

name: Clark L
text: We were WARMLY greeted by Bill, who even stopped mowing the lawn to let us look around. This is a stop on The Hallelujah Trail of Northern Alabama and we're SO GLAD we stopped. It's ANOTHER reminder that God has been faithful to this congregation for over 100 years AND is STILL at work in the area and the world 😇
